description: UK certification scheme to protect against common cyber threats through basic security controls.

metadata.displayName: Source
metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.

metadata.displayName: Warn
metadata.description: Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed capabilities
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

metadata.displayName: Allowed capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a container. Provide empty list as input to block everything.

metadata.displayName: Required drop capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a container.

metadata.displayName: Containers exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Image exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Key Vault secrets should have an expiration date
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Cosmos DB database accounts should have local authentication methods disabled
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Audit: Shut down system immediately if unable to log security audits
metadata.description: Audits if the system will shut down when unable to log Security events.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Windows machines should meet requirements for 'Security Options - Audit'
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Key Vault keys should have an expiration date
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos
metadata.description: Specifies the encryption types that Kerberos is allowed to use.

metadata.displayName: Network security: LAN Manager authentication level
metadata.description: Specify which challenge-response authentication protocol is used for network logons. This choice affects the level of authentication protocol used by clients, the level of session security negotiated, and the level of authentication accepted by servers.

metadata.displayName: Network security: LDAP client signing requirements
metadata.description: Specify the level of data signing that is requested on behalf of clients that issue LDAP BIND requests.

metadata.displayName: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by clients for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/network-security-minimum-session-security-for-ntlm-ssp-based-including-secure-rpc-servers for more information.

metadata.displayName: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by servers for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may access this computer from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which remote users on the network are permitted to connect to the computer. This does not include Remote Desktop Connection.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may log on locally
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups can interactively log on to the computer. Users who attempt to log on via Remote Desktop Connection or IIS also require this user right.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups are permitted to log on as a Terminal Services client, Remote Desktop, or for Remote Assistance.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied access to this computer from the network
metadata.description: Specifies which users or groups are explicitly prohibited from connecting to the computer across the network.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may manage auditing and security log
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups permitted to change the auditing options for files and directories and clear the Security log.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may back up files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies users and groups allowed to circumvent file and directory permissions to back up the system.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may change the system time
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time and date on the internal clock of the computer.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may change the time zone
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to change the time zone of the computer.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may create a token object
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to create an access token, which may provide elevated rights to access sensitive data.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a batch job
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer as a batch job (i.e. scheduled task).

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied logging on as a service
metadata.description: Specifies which service accounts are explicitly not permitted to register a process as a service.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied local logon
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that are denied log on through Remote Desktop Services
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are explicitly not permitted to log on to the computer via Terminal Services/Remote Desktop Client.

metadata.displayName: User and groups that may force shutdown from a remote system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to shut down the computer from a remote location on the network.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that may restore files and directories
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to bypass file, directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions when restoring backed up files and directories.

metadata.displayName: Users and groups that may shut down the system
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups who are logged on locally to the computers in your environment are permitted to shut down the operating system with the Shut Down command.

metadata.displayName: Users or groups that may take ownership of files or other objects
metadata.description: Specifies which users and groups are permitted to take ownership of files, folders, registry keys, processes, or threads. This user right bypasses any permissions that are in place to protect objects to give ownership to the specified user.

metadata.description: Resource Id of the virtual network. Example: /subscriptions/YourSubscriptionId/resourceGroups/YourResourceGroupName/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/Name

metadata.displayName: UAC: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of Admin Approval Mode for the built-in Administrator account.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of application installation detection for the computer.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policy settings for the computer.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Windows machines should meet requirements for 'Security Options - User Account Control'
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Domain profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Domain profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Domain): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Private profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Private profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Private): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Use profile settings
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security uses the settings for the Public profile to filter network traffic. If you select Off, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security will not use any of the firewall rules or connection security rules for this profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Behavior for outbound connections
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior for outbound connections for the Public profile that do not match an outbound firewall rule. The default value of 0 means to allow connections, and a value of 1 means to block connections.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local connection security rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create connection security rules that apply together with connection security rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Apply local firewall rules
metadata.description: Specifies whether local administrators are allowed to create local firewall rules that apply together with firewall rules configured by Group Policy for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall (Public): Display notifications
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security displays notifications to the user when a program is blocked from receiving inbound connections, for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Domain: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Domain profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Private: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Private profile.

metadata.displayName: Windows Firewall: Public: Allow unicast response
metadata.description: Specifies whether Windows Firewall with Advanced Security permits the local computer to receive unicast responses to its outgoing multicast or broadcast messages; for the Public profile.

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths and sub-paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously
metadata.description: Specifies which network shares can be accessed by anonymous users. The default configuration for this policy setting has little effect because all users have to be authenticated before they can access shared resources on the server.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Windows machines should meet requirements for 'Security Options - Network Access'
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: CORS should not allow every domain to access your API for FHIR
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Public network access should be disabled for MySQL servers
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Accounts: Guest account status
metadata.description: Specifies whether the local Guest account is disabled.

metadata.description: Public Endpoint Type for which to enforce the access check

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: [Deprecated]: Members to include
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of members that should be included in the Administrators local group. Ex: Administrator; myUser1; myUser2

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Azure Event Hub namespaces should have local authentication methods disabled
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Source
metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.

metadata.displayName: Warn
metadata.description: Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes cluster pod hostPath volumes should only use allowed host paths
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

metadata.displayName: Allowed host paths
metadata.description: The host paths allowed for pod hostPath volumes to use. Provide an empty paths list to block all host paths.

metadata.displayName: Containers exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from readonly evaluation. It will not exclude the disallowed host path. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Image exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Azure Defender for Resource Manager should be enabled
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Log Analytics workspaces should block log ingestion and querying from public networks
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Managed disks should disable public network access
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: VPN gateways should use only Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) authentication for point-to-site users
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Application Insights components should block log ingestion and querying from public networks
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: The maximum validity in months
metadata.description: The limit to how long a certificate may be valid for. Certificates with lengthy validity periods aren't best practice.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Certificates should have the specified maximum validity period
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Azure Recovery Services vaults should use private link for backup
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Source
metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.

metadata.displayName: Warn
metadata.description: Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Kubernetes clusters should not use the default namespace
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.
